item.title: 澳航在大流行病期间非法解雇 1800 名员工，被罚款 5800 万美元
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的航空公司澳洲航空公司（Qantas Airways）因在 COVID-19 大流行期间非法解雇 1800 名地勤人员并用承包商取而代之而被罚款 9000 万澳元（5864 万美元）。【原文：Qantas Airways , Australia’s largest airline, has been fined A$90 million ($58.64 million) for illegally sacking 1,800 ground staff and replacing them with contractors during the COVID-19 pandemic, a court ruled on Monday.】

item.title: 美元为繁忙的一周地缘政治和美联储讲话做好准备
item.description: 周一，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普与乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）举行重要会晤之前，美元走势踌躇不前，而投资者也期待美联储杰克逊霍尔（Jackson Hole）研讨会提供更多政策线索。【原文：The dollar dithered on Monday ahead of a key meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskiy, while investors also looked ahead to the Federal Reserve's Jackson Hole symposium for more policy clues.】

item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构就反竞争搜索交易起诉谷歌
item.description: 澳大利亚竞争监管机构周一表示，已开始对 Alphabet 旗下谷歌公司过去与电信运营商 Telstra 和 Optus 达成的在安卓手机上预装谷歌搜索的交易提起诉讼。【原文：Australia's competition regulator said on Monday it has begun proceedings against Alphabet's Google over its past deals with telecom operators Telstra and Optus for the pre-installation of Google Search on Android mobile phones.】

item.title: 亚洲股市微幅走高，石油因停战谈判下滑
item.description: 周一，在美国利率政策可能多事的一周到来之前，亚洲股市走高，而油价则因俄罗斯供应风险似乎有所减弱而下滑。【原文：Share markets edged higher in Asia on Monday ahead of what is likely to be an eventful week for U.S. interest rate policy, while oil prices slipped as risks to Russian supplies seemed to fade a little.】

item.title: 据《泰晤士报》报道，由于销量下滑，特斯拉将英国月租费几乎减半
item.description: 据《泰晤士报》周一援引业内人士的话报道，英国驾车者现在只需支付一年前一半多的租金，就能租到一辆特斯拉电动汽车。【原文：British motorists can now lease a Tesla electric vehicle for just over half of what they would have paid a year ago, The Times reported on Monday, citing industry sources.】

item.title: 北美减值导致博思格钢铁公司全年利润暴跌 90
item.description: 澳大利亚博思格钢铁公司（BlueScope Steel）周一报告称，由于涂层产品业务减值费用以及北美业务表现疲软，该公司全年利润下降了 90%。【原文：Australia's BlueScope Steel reported a 90% drop in full-year profit on Monday, after logging an impairment charge for its coated products business and due to weak performance at its operations in North America.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Klook正在为美国首次公开募股寻找银行
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，旅游预订服务公司 Klook 已聘请投资银行帮助安排可能在美国进行的首次公开募股。【原文：Klook, a travel booking services company, has hired investment banks to help arrange a potential initial public offering in the U.S., according to two people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普与普京会晤后，俄罗斯供应担忧缓解，石油下滑
item.description: 油价在周一亚洲早盘交易中下滑，原因是在周五两国总统会晤后，美国没有向俄罗斯施加更大压力，要求其采取进一步措施中断莫斯科的石油出口，从而结束乌克兰战争。【原文：Oil prices slipped in early Asian trade on Monday as the United States did not exert more pressure on Russia to end the Ukraine war by implementing further measures to disrupt Moscow's oil exports after presidents from both countries met on Friday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚国民银行第三季度现金收益小幅增长
item.description: 澳大利亚国民银行周一公布的第三季度现金收益略有增长，主要得益于利润率的提高以及商业和住房贷款的增长。【原文：National Australia Bank reported a slight increase in its cash earnings for the third-quarter on Monday, helped by improved margins and growth in business and home lending.】

item.title: 新西兰 a2 牛奶公司全年利润增长 21
item.description: 新西兰 a2 Milk 公司周一公布，由于其婴儿配方奶粉在第一大市场中国的强劲表现，该公司全年利润增长了 21.1%。【原文：New Zealand's a2 Milk Co reported a 21.1% rise in its full-year profit on Monday, driven by strong performance of its infant milk formula in its top market China.】

item.title: 私募股权集团 Advent 将以 13 亿美元收购 U-Blox
item.description: 私募股权投资集团 Advent International 周日表示，已同意以现金收购瑞士 U-Blox Holding 公司，收购价约为 10.5 亿瑞士法郎（13.0 亿美元）。【原文：Private equity group Advent International said on Sunday it has agreed to take over Switzerland's U-Blox Holding in a cash offer worth some 1.05 billion Swiss francs ($1.30 billion).】

item.title: 美国对乌克兰施压，全球市场未来一周面临震荡
item.description: 欧洲领导人急于在与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的会谈中支持乌克兰，这可能会向基辅施压，迫使其接受有利于俄罗斯的和平协议，因此国防类股票和能源市场可能成为本周的焦点。【原文：Defence stocks and energy markets are likely to be in focus this week, as European leaders rushed to back Ukraine in talks with U.S. President Donald Trump that may pressure Kyiv to accept a peace deal favouring Russia.】

item.title: 加拿大航空公司在指令结束罢工后恢复航班
item.description: 加拿大劳资关系委员会（CIRB）根据加拿大就业部长帕蒂-哈伊杜（Patty Hajdu）的指示结束了导致 700 多个航班停飞的罢工，加拿大航空公司表示计划于周日恢复航班。【原文：Air Canada said it planned to resume flights on Sunday after the Canadian Industrial Relations Board (CIRB) acted on a directive from Canada's Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu to end the strike resulting in the suspension of more than 700 flights.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：欧盟推动保护数字规则阻碍了与美国的贸易声明
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周日报道，欧盟正试图阻止美国将目标对准该集团的数字规则，因为双方正在讨论一份延迟声明的最终细节，以正式确定上个月达成的贸易协议。【原文：The European Union is trying to prevent the United States from targeting the bloc's digital rules as both sides work through the final details of a delayed statement to formalise a trade deal reached last month, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 特朗普与普京阿拉斯加会晤后石油市场看跌
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普和俄罗斯领导人弗拉基米尔-普京在阿拉斯加举行了会晤，特朗普在会晤中表示，乌克兰的目标是达成全面和平协议，而不是停火。【原文：Oil markets are set for a muted price reaction when they open on Sunday after U.S. President Donald Trump's and Russian leader Vladimir Putin's meeting in Alaska, at which Trump said a fully-fledged peace deal was the aim for Ukraine rather than a ceasefire.】

item.title: 加航机舱员工罢工，数百航班停飞
item.description: 在与加拿大最大航空公司的合同谈判陷入僵局后，加拿大航空公司的工会空乘人员于周六清晨离开了工作岗位，此举可能会打乱十多万乘客的旅行计划。【原文：Air Canada's unionized flight attendants walked off the job early on Saturday morning after contract talks with the country's largest carrier stalled, in a move that could disrupt travel plans for more than 100,000 passengers.】

item.title: 特朗普表示没有惩罚中国购买俄罗斯石油的迫切计划
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五表示，他不需要立即考虑对中国等购买俄罗斯石油的国家征收报复性关税，但 "两三周后 "可能不得不这样做。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he did not immediately need to consider retaliatory tariffs on countries such as China for buying Russian oil but might have to "in two or three weeks."】

item.title: 加拿大劳工部长敦促加航与工会加紧谈判解决争端
item.description: 加拿大劳工部长帕蒂-哈伊杜（Patty Hajdu）周五表示，她与加拿大航空公司和加拿大公共雇员工会（CUPE）举行了联合会议，敦促双方更加努力地工作，继续留在谈判桌上，以达成协议，避免可能发生的罢工。【原文：Canadian Labor Minister Patty Hajdu said on Friday that she met jointly with Air Canada and the Canadian Union of Public Employees (CUPE), urging both sides to work harder and remain at the negotiating table to reach a deal and avert a potential strike.】

item.title: 投资者对美俄峰会未达成协议的反应
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五表示，他和俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京在阿拉斯加举行了近三个小时的峰会，但没有就解决莫斯科的乌克兰战争达成协议，不过他认为这次会议 "非常有成效"。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that he and Russian President Vladimir Putin did not reach an agreement to resolve Moscow's war in Ukraine after a nearly three-hour summit in Alaska, though he characterized the meeting as "very productive."】

item.title: 美国商务部扩大征收钢铝关税的产品范围
item.description: 特朗普政府周五扩大了对进口钢铁和铝征收 50%关税的范围，将数百种衍生产品列入征税商品清单。【原文：The Trump administration on Friday widened the reach of its 50% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports by adding hundreds of derivative products to the list of goods subject to the levies.】

item.title: 美联储戴利：今年或多或少宜降息两次
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）在经济报告显示上月零售销售强于预期、批发价格意外跳涨之后接受采访时表示，她仍然支持最快在下个月开始放宽政策。【原文：San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank President Mary Daly, in an interview following economic reports showing stronger-than-expected retail sales and an unexpected jump in wholesale prices last month, signaled that she is still on board for beginning to ease policy as soon as next month.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，Meta 计划在六个月内对人工智能工作进行第四次重组
item.description: 据 The Information 周五援引三位知情人士的话报道，Meta 公司正计划在六个月内对人工智能工作进行第四次全面改革。【原文：Meta is planning its fourth overhaul of artificial intelligence efforts in six months, The Information reported on Friday, citing three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 卢拉在中国工厂开业典礼上表示，巴西对企业敞开大门
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦周五在中国汽车制造商广汽传祺位于圣保罗州的工厂开业典礼上表示，欢迎外国公司来巴西开展业务。【原文：Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said on Friday that foreign companies that want to do business in Brazil are welcome, speaking at the opening ceremony for a factory for Chinese automaker GWM in the state of Sao Paulo.】

item.title: 惠誉将美国精神航空的评级进一步下调至垃圾级
item.description: 惠誉评级公司周五将精神航空的长期信用评级从 "CCC+"下调至 "CCC-"，理由是近期违约的可能性很高。【原文：Fitch Ratings on Friday downgraded Spirit Airlines long-term credit rating to 'CCC-' from 'CCC+', citing a high likelihood of near-term default.】

item.title: 美国钢铁公司克莱顿工厂因煤气阀门故障发生致命爆炸
item.description: 美国钢铁公司周五称，其位于匹兹堡附近的克莱顿焦化厂在计划检修前冲洗煤气阀门时发生致命爆炸，造成两人死亡，10 人受伤。【原文：United States Steel said on Friday a fatal blast that killed two and injured 10 others at its Clairton Coke Works plant near Pittsburgh happened when flushing a gas valve, ahead of scheduled maintenance.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，OpenAI 员工将向软银和其他投资者出售 60 亿美元股票
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五报道，OpenAI 的现任和前任员工正寻求向由软银集团（SoftBank Group）等组成的投资集团出售价值近 60 亿美元的 ChatGPT 制造商股票，估值达 5000 亿美元。【原文：Present and former OpenAI employees are looking to sell nearly $6 billion worth of the ChatGPT maker's shares to an investor group comprising SoftBank Group , among others, valuing it at $500 billion, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.】

item.title: 6 月份外国持有的美国国债攀升至创纪录的 9.13 万亿美元
item.description: 美国财政部周五公布的数据显示，6月份外国持有的美国国债增至创纪录水平，连续第四个月超过9万亿美元。【原文：Foreign holdings of U.S. Treasuries rose to record levels in June, topping $9 trillion for a fourth straight month, data from the Treasury Department showed on Friday.】

item.title: 加密货币交易所双子座公开美国首次公开募股申请文件
item.description: 由亿万富翁双胞胎泰勒-温克莱沃斯（Tyler Winklevoss）和卡梅隆-温克莱沃斯（Cameron Winklevoss）创办的加密货币交易所双子星（Gemini）周五公布了其在美国首次公开募股的文件，加入了数字资产公司寻求进入公开市场的浪潮。【原文：Cryptocurrency exchange Gemini, founded by billionaire twins Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss, on Friday made public its paperwork for a U.S. initial public offering, joining a wave of digital asset companies seeking to tap public markets.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院批准阿根廷搁置 YPF 股份交易的请求
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周五批准了阿根廷的请求，暂时搁置了法官要求阿根廷交出其在油气公司 YPF 51% 的股份以部分履行两名投资者赢得的 161 亿美元判决的命令。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Friday granted Argentina's request to put on temporary hold a judge's order that it turn over its 51% stake in oil and gas company YPF to partially satisfy a $16.1 billion judgment won by two investors.】

item.title: 联合国委员会敦促拉美实现市场多元化以应对特朗普的关税政策
item.description: 联合国拉丁美洲委员会主席何塞-曼努埃尔-萨拉萨尔（Jose Manuel Salazar）敦促该地区各国实现进出口市场多样化，并实现经济一体化，以应对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税。【原文：The head of the U.N. commission on Latin America, Jose Manuel Salazar, urged the region's countries to diversify their export and import markets and to integrate their economies in response to U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.】
